rows.reference:
United Nations Children’s Fund and World Health Organization, State of the World’s Hand Hygiene: A global call to action to make hand hygiene a priority in policy and practice. New York: UNICEF; 2021.

Extract:
Sustainble Development Goal - Service Ladder for Hygiene in Households:
- Basic - Availability of a handwashing facility on premises with soap and water.
- Limited - Availability of a handwashing facility on premises lacking soap and/or water.
- No Facility - No handwashing facility on premises.

In some cultures, ash, soil, sand or other materials are used as handwashing agents, but these are less effective than soap and are therefore counted as a limited service.

rows.title: Set up a handwashing station at home

title.eng: Set up a handwashing station at home

text.eng: A handwashing station is a place where you can wash your hands at home. All you need is a container of water (or a tap), a basin, and some soap. The station makes handwashing easy after tasks like using the toilet, changing a nappy, or working in the garden.

rows.title: How to wash hands

text.eng:
Step 1: Wet your hands with clean water.
Step 2: Use enough soap to cover your hands.
Step 3: Scrub all surfaces of your hands – such as the back of hands, between fingers and under nails. You should scrub for at least 20 seconds.
Step 4: Rinse well with clean water.
Step 5: Dry your hands with a clean cloth or towel.
